transcript.root_cause: Misleading naming: 'ethical_drift' implies moral measurement the system cannot produce reliably; defaults to [0,0,0] and lacks provenance.
proposed_conditions: Rename user-facing concept to constraint_drift (keep ethical_drift as backward-compatible alias)
Require provenance notes when nonzero (short, auditable reason)
Treat as advisory/uncertainty signal, not moral truth; document scope = explicit constraint set
transcript.reasoning: We should not claim to compute 'ethics'. What we can measure (or at least operationalize) is scoped constraint-violation risk + uncertainty. Renaming clarifies capability boundaries and reduces cargo-cult semantics; it also aligns with calibration honesty principles.

Even 'constraint' is value-laden (who chose them?). A float looks more objective than it is; absent a measurement pipeline, it risks cargo-culting a different word. If kept, it should be explicitly scoped, provenance-backed, and not treated as a moral oracle or dominant driver of risk/decision.
concerns: Renaming alone can still smuggle normative assumptions via the chosen constraint set and weights.
Numeric drift invites Goodhart/gaming and over-optimization; may create false authority for unobservable harms.
Without a validated generator, the signal is vibes; better to keep qualitative-first (tags + notes) and limit influence on core decisions.

Document Goodhart risk + calibration expectations; provide 'full' vs 'compact' response modes so the signal doesn’t bloat outputs
